title: Skilled Nominated visa
summary: This page provides official information about the Skilled Nominated Visa (Subclass 190), a permanent residency visa for skilled workers nominated by an Australian state or territory. It outlines visa benefits, eligibility criteria, costs, application requirements, and conditions after grant.

visa_details.description: This visa lets nominated skilled workers live and work in Australia as permanent residents.
visa_details.travel_validity: 5 years from the date of visa grant

permanent_residency_effective_date.if_outside_australia: Date of first entry into Australia with this visa

what_you_can_do: Live and stay in Australia permanently
Work and study anywhere in Australia
Attend free English language classes through the Adult Migrant English Program (if eligible)
Sponsor eligible relatives for permanent residency
Travel to and from Australia for 5 years
Become an Australian citizen if eligible

conditions_and_limitations.waiting_period_for_benefits: Newly arrived residents may need to wait before accessing certain Australian Government payments and benefits.

eligibility.occupation_requirement: Must have an occupation on the relevant skilled list

skills_assessment.requirement: Must have a suitable skills assessment for the nominated occupation
skills_assessment.validity_note: Skills assessment obtained within the 60â€‘day invitation period is accepted (Thapa decision)
medical_and_legal_exemptions: Full, unconditional, or general medical registration with AHPRA
Conditional specialist registration with AHPRA (must allow practice without supervision)
Admission to practice law in the relevant state or territory

nomination.requirement: Must be nominated by an Australian state or territory government agency
nomination.process: Submit an Expression of Interest (EOI) through SkillSelect
nomination.note_on_withdrawn_nomination: If the nominating state or territory withdraws your nomination after application, your application becomes invalid.

special_conditions_for_previous_visas.requirement: Must have held that visa for at least 3 years at the time of application

when_to_include: After lodging the application but before a decision is made

requirements.health_requirements: All family members applying must meet health requirements; non-accompanying family may also need to meet them
requirements.character_requirements: All family members applying must meet character requirements

including_family.note: If partner or dependent children are not included, you must provide a reason.

second_instalment_charge.applies_to: Applicants aged 18 or over with less than functional English
second_instalment_charge.when_paid: Only when requested and only if the visa is going to be granted

tools.visa_pricing_estimator_note: Does not include second instalment or other additional costs

apply_from.location: You can be inside or outside Australia when applying and when the visa is decided
apply_from.additional_requirements_if_in_australia: Must hold a substantive visa or eligible Bridging visa (A, B, or C)

processing_times.disclaimer: Processing times are indicative only and not specific to individual applications
case_by_case_factors: Completeness of the application and documentation
How quickly additional information is provided
Time to receive information from external agencies (health, character, national security)
Number of places available in the migration program

travel.travel_rights: Unlimited travel in and out of Australia for 5 years from visa grant
travel.after_5_years: Need Resident Return Visa (subclass 155 or 157) to re-enter as a permanent resident

visa_label.note: Visa is digitally linked to passport; no physical label provided

support.getting_help_with_visa: Read the information on who can help with your visa application before you pay someone.
